channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description: @Planta Are you wastin‚Äô away again in Margaritaville?

An independent repair shop is charging me $100 for an inspection and cleaning (I told them my theory that it might get the display, trackpad and keyboard [and video camera and microphone] back in working order). If that doesn‚Äôt work, it permanently becomes a desktop computer.

@pvieito I use the Dialpad app. I don‚Äôt know if the voice-based part of it has a web app. That‚Äôs an interesting approach, I‚Äôll give it a try. It sounds like that way, QuietMeet will detect if the app is running and mute Music if it is.

@pvieito Fair enough. I do love the idea, so count me as a happy purchaser. I don‚Äôt know how common it is, but we use @dialpad at work for calls. Is call detection possible with that app, do you think? I use it only at specific times, so maybe I don‚Äôt actually need it. Was just curious.

@pvieito For Zoom, could it detect not just whether the app is running, but whether you‚Äôre in a meeting or not? That‚Äôs so that I can keep the app running at all times. This shows how AppleScript can detect whether a meeting is happening, for example: https://t.co/PB7ers6f7j

Here‚Äôs my list. üßµ https://t.co/JKrNnzNj6R
Toronto Architecture: A City Guide by Patricia McHugh and @alexbozikovic.
Stroll: Psychogeographic Walking Tours of Toronto by @shawnmicallef.
House Divided: How the Missing Middle Will Solve Toronto‚Äôs Housing Crisis by @JohnLorinc, @CheryllCase, @alexbozikovic, and @arkwelder12, eds.

@stephentweedale 7 days is a reasonable bet. This feels like an instance, though, where I‚Äôm not sure if just muting their names would mute the conversations about it. It‚Äôs not like some other subjects where you can mute just one word and the whole discourse becomes invisible to me.

@dylan_reid @Sportsnet Yeah, weird programming choice. They had the full game on Sportsnet One, but I‚Äôm thinking they should have put the late innings of Spring Training baseball (which even baseball fans don‚Äôt care much about) on that channel instead of the other way around.

I‚Äôm dual-screening sports (soccer) and esports (car soccer) this time around. https://t.co/RHOuTtQu7j
https://t.co/Av9yObRyrp
Living in Toronto milestone: Last night, I purposely called someone who also lives here with my Toronto phone number rather than my Vancouver one.

Tonight. https://t.co/PzEhVRHxBO
The evening went by fast. I accidentally bid $110 for an item when I meant $10 (everybody was OK with the correction, but it did cause a stir). I couldn‚Äôt sneak away to the bar as often as I wanted. I did what I could and drank two shots of Brenniv√≠n instead of the offered one.
Goodbye, Swish Chalet that I‚Äôve been to only once, with the woman I had just started seeing at the time. https://t.co/VZsD38q6k1
I got these flowers for my apartment. They‚Äôre pretty, but they‚Äôre not as pretty as you. https://t.co/eOfZD0PeUE
Anybody want to join me in trying to visit all 9+ sites of @TorontoBiennial in one day?

If there‚Äôs anything I love more than exoplanets, it‚Äôs visualizing exoplanets, and if there‚Äôs anything I love more than visualizing exoplanets, it‚Äôs representing exoplanets as musical notes. https://t.co/HT4LhYVs4J
@Kimli Oh good, I was hoping you‚Äôd like it.
Since I can‚Äôt read without my glasses, I too have shampoo-blindness. https://t.co/B4O9uRrweR

Remember the time I posted a ‚ÄúLost Watch‚Äù poster on the city streets of Toronto, hoping someone would find it and return it to me? This is what it looked like (with tabs that had my phone number and an email address at the bottom). https://t.co/jp3mgqczxr https://t.co/kozcj3DW8a
It‚Äôs looking a lot like I‚Äôll be in British Columbia for a joyous occasion in the middle of June. Dates TBD, dependent on something that will happen in Ontario on one of two Sundays that month.
@dailysimpsons ‚ÄúOh, no. No pal of mine is going to stay in some dingy flophouse.‚Äù
@dailysimpsons https://t.co/rx6RBb6eOv
I don‚Äôt know how to relax.

It‚Äôs going ahead, though the way I phrased it at @CanadaPlanner, it could have been interpreted to mean His Holiness was coming to Canada. (Something I might have believed for a while.) When I wrote it, I consulted this guide, which explains my phrasing. https://t.co/t22HowUZh5
The Winnipeg Free Press has a section for its coverage of Pope Francis visiting Indigenous delegates travelling to the Vatican from Canada. https://t.co/Syn7hG5mlw
@dailysimpsons @_rich_moore @jon_vitti @canyonjim @simonsam ‚ÄúOh, no. No pal of mine is going to stay in some dingy flophouse.‚Äù

Life is good if you can eat a hot dog and fries while sitting at an outdoor chess board in the middle of Toronto. https://t.co/T5zFCMQkHD
/cc @Kimli
